title: Contas desconectadas mesmo com configurações para mantê-las ativas
content: Uso o navegador há anos e nunca tive problemas para configurar as preferências. Uso as mesmas sempre. Ultimamente, porém, minhas contas estão sendo desconectadas de um dia para outro. Todas as configurações em "Privacidade e Segurança" seguem iguais. Nas "Configurações de limpeza do histórico", as opções "Contas de acesso ativas" e "Cookies" seguem desmarcadas, como sempre utilizei. No entanto, todo dia preciso relogar todas as contas novamente. Gerencio muitas contas e isso é uma perda enorme de tempo. Não encontrei um suporte oficial e gostaria de saber como resolver isso sendo que não posso contatar a própria empresa.
creator: Ragnar_Haggstrom

title: Firefox 82.Sürüm Gömülü PDF yazdırma raporu.
content:

Bu yazıların Firefox ile gömülü gelen Adobe PDF raporunda çıksın istemiyorum. Bu konuda yardımlarınızı bekliyorum.

Not: Aynı PDF raporunu Chrome da yazdırıyorum, bu bilgiler çıkmıyor.

title: Newest versions of fire-fox unresponsive
content:
Upon installation of the newest versions (v83) of Firefox, Firefox became unresponsive: Unable to click weblinks, scroll, or even click on GUI menu bar options. Restarting in Safe Mode, refreshing, and uninstall/re-install of Firefox failed to solve these issues. Additional troubleshooting involved disabling accessibility, disabling DNS prefetch, adjusting memory cache, disabling network proxy, and etc. as put forth in various forum threads.

Only successful solution was to roll back to version 79 (Last known good version.)

I run Firefox, Firefox Nightly, and Firefox Developer Edition. This allows me to update one interface at a time, while retaining at least one active known good interface in reserve.
creator: MIddKnight

title: Add-ons Compatibility Information
content:
I hope this is appropriate here. If not, please direct me to where it is.

As new releases of Firefox (and Thunderbird too) come out, a constant question for me is whether the add-ons that are important to me (I use a lot) will be compatible with the new release. It would help if

(1) The Add-Ons web site always allowed me to specify release and OS. Sometimes that is allowed, sometimes not.

(2) The Add-Ons web site allowed me to specify a release before which I don't want to see add-ons listed.

(3) The Extensions page in Firefox allowed me to ask which of my extensions (enabled and/or disabled) are supported/not supported in a specified future release.

(4) When Firefox wants to install a new release, it reported on extensions that would become incompatible and always asked my permission to go ahead.

It probably would not be necessary to do all of these things, but I included them all because I don't know which are the most practical.
creator: rfajman

Firefox is my preferred browser.
